text: in the south there's this whole thing or
at least people tell me there's this
whole thing about cooking with greens
you cook with greens you make money it's
sort of the every New Year's you have
collards and you know it's very
important thing nice tradition so we're
gonna do a traditional Louisiana New
Orleans style gumbo with the requisite
amount of greens and scallops which are
really great as with many New Orleans
style dishes you start with a room you
know what's a room Leroux is nothing
more than flour and fat cooked together
until the flour loses all of its flour
enos becomes nutty and brown and
something that really adds flavor
instead of just thickening you take
whatever pot you're using and two
tablespoons of butter about 1/4 cup of
olive oil and that heat can be
medium-high you want to get this going
when the butter melts and goes a third
of a cup of flour and then you see this
nice bubbly mess we have going here and
then you cook over medium heat for it's
gonna be a good 10 minutes until the
mixture really thickens and Browns you
have to be stirring the whole time and
keep adjusting the heat to make sure
this thing doesn't burn because it will
burn but it didn't and now we're adding
chopped onion chopped green pepper some
chopped celery remember I promised you
green things bunch of garlic and we're
just gonna let that cook until the
vegetables soften a bit 5 or 10 minutes
translucent onions the vegetables
slightly softened add some oregano and
some thyme if you have fresh so much the
better
cayenne
to taste say 1/8 of a teaspoon for me a
couple of cups of tomatoes what's really
great is if you have the time to roast
them ahead of time but not necessary bay
leaf let's do two cups of chicken stock
all right let's just do enough chicken
stock to float the whole boat how's that
so you can see the roux is already doing
its work this is much thicker than it
would have been otherwise we're gonna
let this simmer for another ten minutes
or so and then it'll be just about done
okay well this is looking pretty gumbo
esque bubbling away so nice big sea
scallops that a pound of them and I'm
cutting them into quarters because
they're way too big if you cook them
five minutes it's probably four minutes
too long so putting them in I'm turning
off the heat and wait 30 seconds and
serve and the scallops have a lot of
liquid they'll thin this out a bit too
parsley more green
sort of authentic scallop gumbo and I
gotta tell you I know that it might have
seemed strange to some of you but that
put the scallops in turn off the heat
serving they're ready
